Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a cup or bowl; interior: glazed black with narrow band in added red; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of running figures (one leg remaining of one runner; upper thighs and genitals of second), both to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1878) (phase 3)
